metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4148 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's block_invalidatepage infs/buffer.c in the filesystem. A missing sanity check may allow a localattacker with user privilege to cause a denial of service (DOS) problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-kvm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-aws - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-azure - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gcp - 5.15.0-1001.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-oracle - 5.15.0-1001.3
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1002-raspi - 5.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-5.15.0-1002-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required
